context: preoperative diagnoses: 1. posttraumatic nasal deformity.
preoperative diagnoses: 2. nasal obstruction.
preoperative diagnoses: 3. nasal valve collapse.
preoperative diagnoses: 4. request for cosmetic change with excellent appearance of nose.
operative procedures: 1. left ear cartilage graft.
operative procedures: 2. repair of nasal vestibular stenosis using an ear cartilage graft.
operative procedures: 3. cosmetic rhinoplasty.
operative procedures: 4. left inferior turbinectomy.
anesthesia: general via endotracheal tube.
the patient is with symptomatic nasal obstruction and fixed nasal valve collapse following a previous nasal fracture and attempted repair.
the septal angle was approached and submucoperichondrial flaps were elevated.
severe nasal septal deviation to the right hand side and evidence of an old fracture with a separate alignment of the cartilaginous nose from the bony nose was encountered.
inadequate septal cartilage was noted to be present for use as spreader graft;
left postauricular incision was made, and the conchal bowl cartilage graft was harvested,
ear cartilage graft was then placed to put two spreader grafts on the left and one the right.
the upper lateral cartilage was noted to be of the same width and length in size.
the scar bands were released in the lower lateral cartilages to the upper lateral cartilages to allow free mobilization of the lower lateral cartilages.
a middle crus stitch was used to unite the domes,
crushed ear cartilage was then placed in the pockets above the spreader grafts in the area of the deficient dorsal nasal height and the lateral nasal sidewall height.
doyle splints were placed on each side of nasal septum and secured with 3-0 nylon and a denver splint was applied.
